summary: Add an MT Loan access control setup in Settings (name + password + save) and prepare a hidden/blocked User Panel layout skeleton without changing existing design.
architectural_notes: Implement new Settings section without altering existing UI styling/layout beyond inserting the new card in the designated empty space.

existing_features.title: Add a new Settings card/section in the currently empty top area of the Settings screen that contains: (1) a Name input, (2) a Password input, and (3) a Save button. Persist the saved Name+Password locally so they remain available after refresh.

Implement MT Loan password gating: when the MT-LOAN button is clicked (existing header quick action), show a password prompt modal. If the entered password does not match the admin-saved MT Loan password, block access and show an error message. If it matches, mark the session as authorized for MT Loan and auto-create a user identity using the admin-saved Name (store locally); do not expose the User Panel UI yet (integration/navigation will be done later).

Create/keep a User Panel layout skeleton in the codebase, but ensure the entire User Panel is fully hidden/blocked from users for now. Include a logout button placeholder/structure in the hidden User Panel layout so it is ready for later activation.

Do not change any existing UI design or styling while implementing REQ-1 to REQ-3. Only add the new Settings card and the password prompt modal using existing UI primitives and existing styling conventions so the rest of the app remains visually unchanged.
